greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: In A109732, the number 2n+1 appears in position a(n).
link: N. J. A. Sloane and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000 (first 1024 terms from N. J. A. Sloane)
example: 9 appears in position 30 in A109732, so a(4) = 30.
maple: L:=L/3; a:=[op(a),L]; hit[L]:=n; S:= S minus {L};
if hit[2*L+1]=0 then S:=S union {2*L+1}; fi;
else L:=min(S); a:=[op(a),L]; hit[L]:=n; S:=S minus {L};
if hit[2*L+1]=0 then S:=S union {2*L+1}; fi;
mathematica: (* using the M generated in A109732 *) ms=Sort[M]; k=1; While[ms[[k]]==2k-1, k++ ]; k=k-1; Take[Ordering[M], k] (* _T. D. Noe_, Aug 10 2005 *)
xref: Cf. A109732. For records see A109739 and A109740.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 10 2005
ext: More terms from _T. D. Noe_ and _Ray Chandler_, Aug 10 2005
